text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to share

with you how to make some really delicious
and easy salmon fajitas, these are my sheet

pan salmon fajitas, I love them because of
their simplicity and how easy they are to

put together - the oven's ready - and I also
love that you can make a big batch of them

in the oven, say you're having people over
for dinner, it cooks a lot and it's very little

work for you, you can take some shortcuts
from the grocery store and I will walk you

through in a little bit, but for now let me
walk you through the list of what you'll need,

which is not very big but they're all the
right ones.

You'll need some salmon fillets, mine don't
have the skin on them because I don't need

them, but if yours does it's fine, I've got
an array of bell peppers, a couple of onions

that are red and yellow, I've got some garlic,
you'll need some fajita seasoning, store-bought

of homemade, whatever you heart desires, I've
got some store bought so that's what I'm going

to use today, but you can scour the web for
fajita seasoning mix and make your own which

I'm sure you already have the ingredients
on hand for.

Then you'll need some soy sauce, lime juice,
light olive oil or any flavorless oil like

an avocado oil will do, a little squeeze of
honey, and then for the topping which I love,

I love to do this really delicious slaw, this
jalapeno slaw, what I have here is just some

coleslaw mix, I love this, you an buy it pre-made,
pre-shredded, it's got regular cabbage, red

cabbage and carrots, all shredded, cilantro,
lime, avocado, you'll need a jalapeno, and

some salt which I don't have out here yet,
but I'll get to it in a second.

Alright, let's get going on marinating the
salmon really quickly, now because I'm adding

citrus juice, or like an acid to the fish,
I'm on;y going to let this marinate for about

twenty minutes or so, any longer and the acid
starts breaking down the fish and you'll end

up with ceviche, so never marinate seafood
with acid overnight because you'll end up

with ceviche, delicious but that's not what
we're going for here.

In this bowl, I'm going to add soy, I'm going
to add a little bit of light olive oil, something

flavorless, a little squeeze of honey, just
to balance out the saltiness, and to balance
out the lime, the acid from the lime.

I love this recipe, and I'm actually going
to cut this in half because it's pretty big,
well I could fit it.

It's pretty big so I'm just going to use half
of that.
Reserve this for the slaw.

And then I'm going to need a couple of cloves
of garlic, I'm going to finely chop them and

then I'm going to add the salmon in there
and let it sit for twenty minutes and then

we'll work on the peppers and the onions if
I can get the garlic out of here.
Adding the garlic and the cilantro.

And now what I'm going to do is add the salmon
right in, just make sure you kind of coat

it around, just want to make sure that it's
touching the marinade.

Trust me because it's so strongly flavored,
like the soy and what not, it's going to give

it so much delicious flavor, now that that's
going to sit aside for twenty minutes or so,

maybe a little bit longer, the oven is preheated
to 425F, I've got a large baking sheet that

I've lined with parchment paper so that it
saves me on some cleanup, what I'm going to

work on next is slicing my peppers and onions,
I want them to be about the same thickness
so that they cook evenly.

So I'm going to cut this in half, core it
and then just slice it into some beautiful
slices.

Alright, so I've got a lot of onions and peppers
here sliced, so it looks like a lot compared

to the three pieces of salmon, and that is
because there are only going to be three of

us for dinner tonight otherwise I would put
more salmon on it, but also the roasted vegetables

with all of the juices and the spices and
everything, oh my goodness leftover on a salad

or on top of rice tonight for dinner are so
delicious so I always make sure to make extra
because we just love it.

So, to the veggies I'm going to add just a
little bit of light olive oil.
Couple tablespoons.

And then some of your fajita seasoning, now
my fajita seasoning, because it's store bought,

it's already got some salt in it so I don't
need to add any additional salt otherwise

it would be too salty, and now I'm just going
to go in and really massage everything to

make sure all the peppers and the onions are
coated and it smells so good, and I'm going

to pop this into the oven now because the
veggies just need a bit of a heads up of a

cooking time before we add the salmon, because
obviously the salmon cooks a lit quicker,

so these are going to go into a 425F oven
for about twenty minutes or so and I will

show you what they look like when they are
done, and meanwhile the salmon is fine, it
can just rest there until I am ready for it.

So I want to work on the slaw now while the
peppers are in the oven because the acid from

the lemon juice is going to break down the
cabbage a little bit which is exactly what

I want so in here I just have the coleslaw
mix, I've sliced a couple scallions, a little

bit of jalapeno, this jalapeno in particular
is so hot, the batch that we bought are super

spicy so I'm only using half that I've thinly
sliced, and then a little bunch of chopped

cilantro, a good healthy pinch of salt, and
then the juice of half of the other lime because

it's a really juicy lime, so I'm only doing
half, but if it was a smaller, not so juicy

lime then I would do a whole one because I
want this pretty limey, and I'm just going

to toss everything together with a fork and
let it just sit aside for the remainder of

the time and everything needs to cook which
once the salmon goes in, it'll take another

fifteen minutes or so, ten to fifteen minutes,
the peppers are in there so it's got a good

amount of time, so just toss it all together,
you'll be surprised what happens in the next

ten minutes with that lime really breaking
down the cabbage, but still keeping it's vibrant

crunch and it's so limey and delicious, I
forgot a small drizzle of oil just to get
everything going.
And that's it!
Set this aside and you're ready to go.

The peppers were in the oven for about twenty
minutes, then you take your beautiful salmon

fillets, pop them right on there like so,
beautiful!
Oh it smells so good!

Gorgeous, don't you dare throw away any of
the marinade.
Just pour that right over everything.

Using my clean hand just sprinkle a little
bit of fajita seasoning on the salmon.

You're going to pop this into the oven for
about fifteen minutes or until the salmon

is fully cooked through and it flakes really
easily, my mouth is watering it smells so
phenomenal in here - I'm hungry!

Going to pop this in and show you what this
looks like when it's done, the thing is yelling

at me because the time is up, wash my hand
first.

Alright, so once the salmon went on I popped
it in for actually twenty minutes and it is

just perfection it smells so good in here,
I'm just sprinkling a little bit of fresh

cilantro over-top now this is going to sound
really crazy but you know me, I'm a crazy

loon, I just really like the idea of putting
your slaw right on top.

You serve this whole thing at the table with
some warm tortillas, a little bit of fresh

avocado, and look at this suddenly you've
got an absolute magnificent feast that didn't

take you a lot of time to put together, you
can buy pre-sliced peppers and onions at your

grocery store, if you want to or you can cut
them up a couple days before hand if you're

coming home at the end of a long day and you
know you've got people coming over, and it's

just magnificent, you don't need rice, you
just need some warm tortillas which I do have,

I'm a corn tortilla fan so that's what I'll
be serving.

You don't need rice, you just need tortillas,
I've got some avocado here that I'm going

to slice up and serve it with, I've got fresh

on top and it's just I mean I want a little
bit of slaw right now and a little bit of

pepper and then I'll go into the salmon, but
it smells fantastic and looks welcoming, it's

exactly what I want to serve to my friends
and family at the end of a long day, it's
fun, it's easy, mmm.
Wow!

Something was hanging, it fell down, it's

It's a twist on a classic that you know most
people will love, and it's fabulous and it's

also a great way to make salmon go a long
way because two people can share one fillet

because you're going to be wrapping it in
tortilla, I'm going to have a piece of salmon
and the slaw.
That is perfect.
That's what I want to eat for dinner.
That's what I am going to eat for dinner!
And you could be doing it too.

Go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get the written
